title: Shadow Stick Method for Accurate East-West Direction
brief: Use a shadow stick and string arc to determine an accurate east-west line over the course of a day.
steps: Step 1: Set up your shadow stick in the morning and mark the first shadow tip.
Step 2: Use string to draw a clean arc through this mark, centered on the stick.
Step 3: Wait until afternoon when the shadow lengthens again after midday.
Step 4: Mark the second point where the afternoon shadow touches the arc.
Step 5: Draw a straight line through both shadow marks to get an accurate east-west line.
warnings: This method requires most of a day to complete - not suitable for immediate navigation needs.
